website_summaries.verdict: A reliable wooden product from Melissa & Doug that works great with LEGOs or any other small blocks or toys your child might enjoy.
pros: Table works with lots of different types of toys and can grow with your child's interests
Split top allows 2 bases at the same time
cons: This table does not have a pegged top to directly attach LEGO blocks to like others on the market

customer_reviews.title: Perhaps poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: The product appears to be sturdy and instructions are very clear. The reason I'm giving two stars is due to a defective hole placement. One of the pre-drilled hole is bit further out than the other three sides. Due to this, the bolt will not reach the nut. I may have to go out to a hardware store and try finding a screw that might fit. 1/18/17 UPDATE No response from the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Justmom

customer_reviews.title: Large sturdy multi-use play table with manufacturers defect
customer_reviews.text: Nice sturdy multi use activity table. It took my husband about 30 mins to assemble By himself. I knocked off one star because the drawer panel was unpainted (see photo) and I didn't want to go through the trouble of sending the whole thing back just for the drawer panel so I called Melissa and Doug's customer service to send a new panel and it was an easy and painless process. Other than that, my 3 yr old loves this table and finally enjoys playing in his playroom. We also got the waterfall bucket train set by Kidcraft. It's compatible with the Janod train set we already have so it worked out perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Jenilyn W.

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: The green comes off when wiped with a Lysol wipe, or just water and a paper towel... it’s made of fiber board, so it the finish comes off.... DONT GET IT WET! Didn’t last long- crumbs and legos get stuck in cracks- screws lost traction and the table crumbled-
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: Great product, good quality, kids love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this! My kids use it for hours on end building LEGOs. Perfect product for the price, great quality. If I could change two things: 1) the green color surface, so harsh and ugly but we covered it with light grey LEGO building boards (fits 6 boards measuring 15x15), and 2) would make sense to have small storage drawers all the way around, there’s only one super tiny drawer and it doesn’t maximize storage potential — that said, my kids love it, so for the price I’m happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: G. Art

customer_reviews.title: They love it! It feels very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: We recently purchased this for a group gift for our 3 kids, ages 7, 3 and 2. They love it! It feels very sturdy, and so far has been getting heavy daily use. The two deciding factors were the quality of Melissa and Doug, and the plain green top. I bought a Thomas the train playboard to put on top when the kids are playing trains, but they also like the option to take it off and play legos, puzzles or dollhouse on it. We will use this table for years! It was definitely worth it for us and I would recommend to anyone with small kids.
customer_reviews.author: BigMamaD

customer_reviews.title: Quality control lacking.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy to put together. The main problem is quality. The issues I have with the table are the same as many other reviews. There is so many little mistakes in the parts of the table. Some pieces only have one coat of paint while other panels are solid white. Some holes don't match. One side of the table has sunken holes to allow the screws to lay flat and the other side doesn't. Chips and scratches everywhere. Huge ugly product sticker on the side of the table that's impossible to take off. Not worth the hassel of returning so we will keep it. My kids will just mess it up more anyways.
customer_reviews.author: jessicakaylee88

customer_reviews.title: I’m extremely disappointed in this table.
customer_reviews.text: I love Melissa and Doug products and its extremely disappointing how bad this table is. It’s not very sturdy, the drawer is hard to open and there is a 1/2” gap on the sides of the table top and 1/4” gap on the front and back end. We got this for our 2.5 year old son for Christmas and I literally have nothing good to say about it. I’m extremely disappointed in the quality of this product and will be choosing a product other then Melissa and doug for my future purchases.
customer_reviews.author: NicoleGeneva

customer_reviews.title: Good table with a caveat
customer_reviews.text: size and design are fine, but two dings. The box arrived ok, but once opened the table top was dented and chipped in the middle (bigger dent small chip). The other thing, there is about a 1/4" gap on all sides between the table top and the sides. This allows all sorts of things to get wedged into that area (like legos) that are hard to take out. Wish the fit was more exact. For a $100 or $100+ table you wouldn't expect to see these issues.
customer_reviews.author: Same

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for activities!
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old is always wanting to play with legos, blocks, slime, anything messy so when we stumbled across this on amazon, we knew we had to buy it. It is perfect for any type of activity, and the size is perfect for multiple kids to play at once and have their own personal space. This table really has been an incredible addition to our play room, I no longer have to endure the pain of stepping on legos because my son actually keeps them on the table! My only small complaint is the green top did have some blemishes in the color on one end, it does get easily scratched as well.
customer_reviews.author: carrie mathes

customer_reviews.title: Spacious play surface
customer_reviews.text: I contemplated between this activity table and other activity tables that featured printed tracks and landscape. In the end, I chose this table for its size and because of the solid color surface. This table takes up a lot of space which is great for my son’s train tracks and race car tracks. However, it is big so that takes up floor space, limiting other more stationery play sets. Since we have a playroom dedicated to him and the playroom is rather large, this table worked out. See picture of the large play surface.
customer_reviews.author: Yileng Li

customer_reviews.title: What a wonderful buy!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is one GREAT play table. Our grandson (2 years old) loves it. He especially loves the drawer, which by the way, slides open easily. He stores his cars and trucks in the drawer and takes them in and out with ease. I can't say one bad thing about this table and in all honesty am surprised by some of the negative reviews and complaints. I don't have a single complaint. My husband and I assembled it (yes all of the parts were there) in about an hour. GREAT table for kids. I feel our grandson will definitely play with this for quite some time. Beautiful job Melissa & Doug.
customer_reviews.author: kdg

customer_reviews.title: A nice solid play table with some minor annoyances.
customer_reviews.text: This table is quite large which allows for a lot of space to play with any type of toy you want. I don't really understand the split table top. It doesn't affect play much, but every now and then a toy gets stuck in the crease. Plus, there are two large holes in the table that toys can fall in as well. The shelf is pretty small and won't hold much.
customer_reviews.author: Eric M

customer_reviews.title: Awful Quality - C'mon Melissa and Doug!
customer_reviews.text: This table is awful quality! It is not up to standard with Melissa and Doug products. The table top doesn't fit the table completely and there is a gap all along the edges (little fingers, little toys can fall through, get trapped, etc.). The drawer doesn't slide, and since it's just MDF, it grinds and leaves "sawdust" every time you open or close it. And it smells bad. We were really excited about this table since we typically trust Melissa and Doug products - but we will pass on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't assemble :(
customer_reviews.text: Went to assemble this Christmas Eve and the holes on two parts were not drilled so we couldn't put it together. SO DISAPPOINTING as this was to be the table for our 2.5 yo son's train set from Santa. I have left two messages on the M&D help line (just connects you to a VM - what kind of help is that?) and no reply. SO FRUSTRATED. Usually love their stuff. UPDATE: Was promised replacement parts to arrive in 7-10 days. That was 15 days ago. GRRRRRRRRR.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Good size but not sturdy?
customer_reviews.text: The table is a great size and looks like lots of fun but the reduced score is because of a lack of sturdiness and because the top pieces (the play area) is not flush with the edges, making it possible to lose little LEGO pieces down there. Also, while the pieces are solid, the table wobbles even though all screws are all the way in, making me feel like something is off. Perhaps there is something off with this particular item, if so, I hope customer service gets in touch. Though I’d rather not go through the trouble of assembling it all again with a three year old climbing excitedly all over...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Train Table and So Much More!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get my son a train table for his third birthday. I hesitated getting this Melissa and Doug table because of the price, but I’m so glad I decided to buy it. It is really fantastic quality and I love that the table top can be used for other toys and not just trains. I would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: mastock

customer_reviews.title: Custom Lego Table
customer_reviews.text: This is a great donor for a Lego table. I added a bottom for proper storage, eliminated the drawer, painted the inside of the table storage area with oil based white paint, added some Lego decals, did liquid nails to attach 6 of the 15x15 Lego sheets and then put 4 of the 10x10 green ones on the front to spell my daughter's names. Very sturdy and perfect after modifications. It still has the ability to store items under the table.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Cox

customer_reviews.title: Super sturdy
customer_reviews.text: When my newly turned two year old climbs on top of it and jumps on it during the 30 seconds I have my back turned, it holds his weight and doesn't even creak. We've turned the table top over and modified it to glue lego plates on one and magnetic chalkboard paint on the other. He loves playing with his trains as well as his lego and magnets on this table. It's the perfect height for him and the drawer holds his train stuff perfectly (when I can get him to actually put his toys away).
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Terrible smell
customer_reviews.text: To be honest, the smell is SO BAD even made my eyes feel irritate for a super long time. You can smell it STRONGLY for at least two months. Are you sure it is NON-Toxic Kids Safe table? However when I assembled it, I was tired to box it back to return. It is so sad that we don’t have many choices for this kind of table out there. Expensive for the quality as a “well known”brand, flimsy materials not hardwood for 95% of this table.
customer_reviews.author: Yiheng

customer_reviews.title: Hope it lasts!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the grandkids to use with their wooden train set. It was easy to put together seems fairly sturdy. Time will tell. I give it 4 stars due to the fact as you can see from the photos, the screws in the packing were pressed against the green top and left several marks and indentations. The green tops should be packed against each other, not facing out. The other side is rough particle board.
customer_reviews.author: ReviewR

customer_reviews.title: Bad odor, defect part, poor drawer.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. It’s marketed as clean, safe, but in fact it has a huge, terrible smell. One of the part is defect. Luckily we walked around this issue. The drawer is NOT flush with the side board. Another example of poor quality. In short this one has way poorer quality/finish than IKEA. Keep that in mind when you place the order.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Hu

customer_reviews.title: Fitment problems
customer_reviews.text: This table is large and great as a kids play table. The only problem i have are the fitment issues in my pictures. The top is not flushed with the table so there is a small gap on yhe top and side of the table. This can cause fingers to get stuck. Anoyher fitment issue is yhe side near the legs. The side sticks out and not flushed with the table. Think these are manufacturing issues thats not made correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: 3 years later, happier than ever!
customer_reviews.text: What a fantastic little table. We struggled to find anything else similar and have happily used it for the last three years for Lego cities, puzzles, art projects, a dance stage, anything and everything you can think of... Sturdy as can be. Simple assembly.
customer_reviews.author: shawn m espinosa

customer_reviews.title: NOT easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: This was not easy to assemble. Some the holes were not pre-drilled well. Definitely need two people to assemble more easily. I am not sure why this couldn’t have arrived with a little less assembly required. Almost all of our toys are Melissa and Doug, but this is the first time buying a larger furniture type piece. I won’t be buying a larger piece again. It doesn’t seem to be nearly the quality of other Melissa and Doug products.
customer_reviews.author: kanets

customer_reviews.title: Great value and quality as expected from Melissa & Doug
customer_reviews.text: Received this last weekend. My son loves Thomas the Train and his wooden tracks, but it was becoming a pain always laying them out on the floor and putting them back over and over. This way we can build a nice track and actually leave it out to play. Not to mention that we can sit in a chair to play with him instead of uncomfortably on the floor. This is actually bigger than expected. The drawer is a bit sticky and can be difficult to pull out because it's not on rollers, but no big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Hayley Wessler

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 24 hours
customer_reviews.text: I reviewed endlessly for train table and decided on this. I love Melissa and Doug and feel they make great products. However this table was broke within 24hours. I have a two year who was pushing with his legs while laying down watching tv and the screws cracked thru. A table designed for children should be able to stand up to a 25 lb toddle pushing it. My husband patched it up as best he could to try to make it look betterVery disappointed and very sad that know I have this piece of junk in my house. Total bummer and let down. #momfail
customer_reviews.author: MarcelloF

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made!!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible table ... the draw made so cheap and doesn’t go in and out without lifting it up just to the right spot and pulling out!! Go to shop it back and they only want to give me 50 dollars back !!! Mise well keep it then!!! I knew I should have went with a different one !!!! So so upset about this!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Table for Kids!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this table for my 2 year old son. He plays with a combination of Thomas trains and the Melissa and Doug train set. It's larger than the other comparable tables and seems durable. My only problem now is my son connects about 30 train cars and gets mad when they can't be pulled around all of the turns. But, that isn't the table's fault. It's doing its job just fine. My teenage daughter assembled it and didn't complain so I doubt it's very hard. I recommend this table for the great number of wooden, interchangeable train sets and many other toys that need to be set up for and reachable by small children!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Williams

customer_reviews.title: Screws
customer_reviews.text: We were really excited for the arrival of this activity table for my son to use for his train set. Unfortunately while putting it together we noticed a few default screws. (See attached photo) I'm unsure of what you may call it but the screw on the right is what it should look like. We took it to a few local hardware stores and they didn't have anything similar to use that would fit and sadly we do not live near a Home Depot or Lowes. My son has many Melissa and Doug products he loves but this table is going to have to be shipped back.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Sung

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: This product came with missing parts to put it together. My husband has been to the hardware store 3 times trying to find the right screws to assemble it. The box was all beat up and barely sealed so who knows what else fell out. The pieces themselves have some chips too. Pretty disappointed as my son is really excited but we can’t seem to put it together because things are missing.
customer_reviews.author: Evie Nikolaou

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to our playroom
customer_reviews.text: Raised edges keep toys off the floor. Drawer provides extra storage and we bought Tupperware storage containers for Legos, trucks, etc. that fit easily underneath. Assembly is fairly basic and as long as you have decent handyman skills it shouldn't take much more than 45 minutes. I read some reviews about poor quality of the material before purchasing which concerned me at first but I've had it assembled for over a month now and haven't had any issues. Even moved the table after assembling and my son is a wild child that likes to climb on top of it and bang his toys around. It's really all about how securely and properly you assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Stevie Stiles

customer_reviews.title: Worth The Price
customer_reviews.text: This play table is perfect! 25 years ago I built a doll house for my girls. Now they are all grownup we resurrected it and are going to rehab the house for my 4 year old granddaughter. Today the table arrived. I will admit to being a bit intimidated when I first saw it. But it wasn't as bad as I thought! I am a 62 year old nurse. Not an engineer by any means. This old Grandmother was able to assemble this entire table by myself in about 2 hours. It looks great and the doll house fits perfectly! A great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Margie Watters

customer_reviews.title: This table is fantastic. I guess I didn't read the description clearly ...
customer_reviews.text: This table is fantastic. I guess I didn't read the description clearly because I thought there was a drawer on both sides, which would have been really nice but oh well. I should have read better. Other than that, the table is sturdy, fairly easy to put together (took about 30 minutes), easy to move around, and has plenty of space underneath for a couple of storage bins of legos.
customer_reviews.author: Alyson Palermo

customer_reviews.title: Very nice quality and size
customer_reviews.text: Great table. Very sturdy and wide my grandson is 4 and it comes up to his waist. We have his whole tr Qaeda in set on it. Great set up. This is my 3rd purchase from this company which included the whole train set. I plan on ordering from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Emoni7

customer_reviews.title: Great product, sturdy, and lots of room under the table for extra storage.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely need to lay out your workspace and check your parts. One of the boards with pre-drilled holes was put on backwards at the factory but other than that little snafu, the assembly was a breeze. Seems very sturdy and my kids already love it. I measured the space under the table and have already purchased totes of varying sizes to go under the table for even more storage. Really cleaned up my playroom nicely.
customer_reviews.author: B. Vetter

customer_reviews.title: Play Table Setup for Wood Train Set
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this at Christmas for our nephew's wood train set. It works great and is the perfect height for him at 3 years old. It is a great tool to keep his train set in one place and setup for him to play with.
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Great table!
customer_reviews.text: We love this table! Was so simple to put together. Didn’t take long at all. Pretty good quality! We’re using it for LEGO sets, that have already been built. We love Melissa and Doug products. It was also bigger than I expected. But I also didn’t bother looking at the dimensions.
customer_reviews.author: Amd85

customer_reviews.title: Best multi use table ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best $100 I have ever spent. My granddaughter has so many lego sets that fall apart because she has nowhere to set them up. This is so large that she can set up a town on one side and play on the other side. Absolutely love this product. We had this exact table before and sold it when we moved out of state. Had to rebuy it for her now, at 8 years because it was sorely missed.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Blank-Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous play table
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in super condition. Was not difficult to assemble, but did take two people. It is larger than we expected, but perfect size for our two year old to use his wooden train set, duplo blocks, v-tech tracks, etc. The drawer does not hold much, but there is space underneath where you can put bins or boxes for storage to use the space wisely. This will be a great addition to the playroom for years to come!
customer_reviews.author: SMR

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: Nice big table but not engineered very well with gaps around the top and holes in it for finger pull and also the drawer has hole in it for grip instead of handle on outside. All the toys fall out the draw hole. The table is nice and big and sturdy enough for play area. I have 3 despite the cons for 2 boys building legos and displaying the sets on.
customer_reviews.author: erica

customer_reviews.title: Great play table for our 14 month old (and he will use it for years)
customer_reviews.text: Was very pleased with the quality, took a long time to assemble, maybe an hour. I will say this, everything was labelled and great instructions. IKEA could take lessons from these guys as they made it easy. The table is actually really big, much bigger than I thought and we get a great lot of ur son's toys on it. He is 14 months old and he loves standing up playing with his toys now rather than sitting on the ground playing. There were a few edges that were a bit sharp but we just got a nail file and lightly sanded them down and then it was fine. Overall a good buy and we are very happy.
customer_reviews.author: DAZ

customer_reviews.title: what do I love about this table Pros
customer_reviews.text: Hmm... what do I love about this table Pros: It's white so fits with most decore. Easy set up. Fits Melissa and doug train Under the bed storage bins can slide underneath Resale value is around 60 dollars and I only paid 85 new here on amazon. So I will only be out of 25 dollars when I get rid of it here in a year or 2. Cons: No room for chairs.. even under the sides It has a lot of furniture board to it... so even after weeks... my son room smells of it ... PHEW! The top gets scratched easily
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Wont last forever
customer_reviews.text: The problem with this table is it didn't wear well and we couldn't take it with us when we moved since so much of the particle board had chipped it's not mean to be taken apart and reassembled, and It's not sturdy enough (like the kind at book stores) to hold up to a move.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Great play table
customer_reviews.text: Great table, by far the best I've come across, docked a star because for $3 worth of material I was able to make the green tops fit without letting all my son's Legos fall through, you could have just done that. Highly recommend otherwise, it has become the center of our playroom.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: What a great table! This was very easy to put together ...
customer_reviews.text: What a great table! This was very easy to put together (even with a toddler "helping"). The product says the table is two sided but never shows any pictures, so for anyone interested, the other side of the table top is just plain particle board. I ended up gluing duplo bases to the green side and painted the plain side with chalk board paint. This table is very sturdy and well made; so glad we purchased it!
customer_reviews.author: E. H.

customer_reviews.title: The table went together pretty easy and is very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The table went together pretty easy and is very sturdy. One part did not have holes cut deep enough to have the screws catch but a quick call to the company and they sent the piece out free of charge. One of the corner just has a bit of the finish crack of but again a quick call and the company is sending out a replacement piece. The table is a good size for my two boys to have endless fun playing train and cars on. Love this brand!!!
customer_reviews.author: KatHug

customer_reviews.title: Great table for the littles
customer_reviews.text: It’s big, and just what the kids will need for a train set. Very sturdy! Funny directions to keep you motivated, and very easy to follow. Easily could be put together by one person. The middle drawer could use to be bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tornado proof
customer_reviews.text: Well what can I say! It's tornado proof, I purchased it for my two and a half year old grandson and yep he is a bruiser, climbing onto things and everything he has to be investigated. The stable box is great for imaginary sailing ships to ward off pirates, or to redesign his wooden toy train, or whatever his mind can conjure up. Its well designed and built and safe. It took a day for my son in law to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: S. Gosenson

customer_reviews.title: SAVE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: Well, the table did not last four months without a getting an enormous crack in the left front corner. We push the table against the wall when not in use by kids and pull it out 12 inches for play. It's so cheaply made, it did not withstand this action, though many reviews said kids could even sit on it. I was looking for a table that would last at least three years and that all our grandchildren would enjoy. I almost always look to Melissa and Doug products first when buying toys. this was a waste of money and not a very "green" product now that it will wind up in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: JULIANNE IDA GREEN

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as a christmas gift for our son and we ended up falling in love with the product. We were concerned regarding the assembly but the parts came all correctly numbered and the manual was so easy to follow. There are products out there that you need to take a course in college to be able to figure out how to put everything together but this is not the case. It is an amazing product, so satisfied that we made the right choice by buying it. Congrats Melissa and Doug, I give a 10 with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Z1177

customer_reviews.title: Great But Has a Scratch!!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this in the mail a few hours ago! I would give it a full five stars, except one of the green top panels is scratched! And my three-year-old daughter said, “That stinks mommy, it’s scratched!“ This is a birthday gift to her so I was very disappointed. Otherwise, it is in very good condition. It seems incredibly sturdy, and well-made. I was able to put it together by myself in just under two hours. Directions are very clear and easy to follow. Aside from the scratch, this looks like it will be a wonderful table!
customer_reviews.author: Neen

customer_reviews.title: Damaged, but cute.
customer_reviews.text: My son received this as a birthday gift and he loves it! My only issue is that one of the green boards is scratched. The box was never opened, so it must have been scratched during production.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Table may be great but arrived with damage to wood.
customer_reviews.text: Box and product arrived damaged, which we didn’t realize until opening a week later and then it was so heavy and cumbersome, that by the time we got it repackaged, we missed the return pickup deadline. Our fault for not having it ready to go and being able to be home for UPS pickup but it’s difficult working and being able to be home to arrange for pick up. Also frustrating to buy something that big that returning wasn’t as easy as what we do for smaller items. Will be mindful about any large purchases in the future.
customer_reviews.author: SameDC

customer_reviews.title: Block out an hour or so to put it together
customer_reviews.text: Easy to follow directions but do not use a drill or driver to put the wood screws in, it snaps the heads right off. Use the manual screwdriver. Once its together the table is nice for them to play with trains and such on but it gives your toddler another climb up and launch point be warned.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Waddell

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my Grandson
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 3 yr old Grandson. Took a little over an hour to assemble by my self. All pieces were complete except for 2 pre-drilled holes for the braces which were not pre-drilled. Simple fix but should have been caught by their quality control. The table goes together easy and is very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: R. Gaddis

customer_reviews.title: Not that great
customer_reviews.text: Nice size my kids love it, but the top is really flimsy and you can't get it wet including cleaners or it bubbles up. And the top also chips easily too. For the proce inwas expecting something a little sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's Melissa & Doug!
customer_reviews.text: Melissa and Doug products are fun to have for kids. The quality is always a plus, and they make nice wood products. This is a nice table top for kids to play with toys.
customer_reviews.author: Raptur3

customer_reviews.title: Great table for train set!
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and large! Perfect size for my very tall two year old to play with his train set. I want to also note that I’m not misses bob the builder whatsoever... this table took me about 1.5hrs to put together. Very easy assembly. I also want to mention that Melissa and Doug product instructions are the best I’ve ever seen... everything was correctly lettered and even the parts were organized together! No searching through a bag of screws to find J!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tiny storage but good table
customer_reviews.text: The table is good but I don't understand why they do not add a larger drawer or multiple drawers. It's a huge table with a tiny drawer. However the quality of what is there is great. We discovered that empty paper boxes fit almost exactly underneath. So we slide a bunch of those underneath to help the storage match the table's footprint in the room.
customer_reviews.author: Matt B

customer_reviews.title: Can't even email melissa and doug, site says it can't be reached!!!
customer_reviews.text: The problem was not putting it together, it was the drawer. The holes were offset on one side which caused the screw to go in wrong and caused to crack and of course the drawer would not close. See photo above. product_meta.title: Melissa & Doug Deluxe Wooden Multi-Activity Table
product_meta.description:
Featuring a double-sided play board and built-in drawer for convenient storage, this all-purpose play station is ideal for trains, dollhouses, art projects, blocks, and puzzles. Easy to assemble, the table’s large surface area and kid-friendly height ensure that there will be plenty of room to spread out and color, learn a new craft, or play a game. With a large 50-inch-by-32.5-inch (L x W) surface area, this table offers a spacious platform for a variety of activities. Its 16-inch height is conveniently sized for young children, making it easy for them to access the table while either kneeling or sitting on the floor. The generously sized play surface allows two kids to play separate activities at the same time. To make clean up and storage easy, the table features a jumbo-sized drawer on the side that can store games, art supplies, and other playtime accessories. Our multi-activity play table contains a jumbo drawer that helps to store games, train tracks, puzzle pieces, art supplies, and more in a convenient and professionally-built storage area. This table for trains, puzzles and games features two removable panels that are easy to lift out to clean or to vacuum underneath the area. Its multipurpose design makes it a great option for encouraging screen-free play. The Melissa & Doug Deluxe Wooden Multi-Activity Play Table is a great gift for kids 3 to 8 years. The play table measures 16" x 32.5" x 50" when assembled and weighs 59.8 pounds. Add the Melissa & Doug Mega Race Car Carrier to inspire hours of hands-on, screen-free, pretend play fun. For more than 30 years, Melissa & Doug has created beautifully designed imagination- and creativity-sparking products that NBC News called “the gold standard in early childhood play.” Today, Melissa & Doug is proudly partnering with the American Academy of Pediatrics to foster early brain development and help children build important life skills through play.

BRAND STORY
By

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
From classic wooden toys to crafts, pretend play, and games, Melissa & Doug products provide a launch pad to ignite imagination and a sense of wonder in all children so they can discover themselves, their passions, and their purpose. 

Since the company’s founding more than 25 years ago, Melissa & Doug has consistently delivered innovative products that inspire open-ended thinking, encourage kids to see new possibilities, and offer Countless Ways to Play. It’s part of a bigger vision to Take Back Childhood. Because by giving children a true childhood with the space and freedom to explore their world, we give them a path to realizing their full potential!
